meanings.definition: A climbing plant with small greenish flowers and red or black berries.
meanings.sent1: The bryony twisted around the fence in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bryony growing up the side of the house.
meanings.sent3: The bryony seemed to be playing a game of hide-and-seek with the other plants.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like a bryony in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The bryony's vibrant red berries stood out against the green leaves.

meanings.definition: Any of various plants of the genus Bryonia.
meanings.sent1: The herbalist used bryony in her remedies.
meanings.sent2: I read about the different types of bryony found in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the bryony.
meanings.sent4: His words spread through the town like the seeds of bryony carried by the wind.
meanings.sent5: The bryony's delicate leaves danced in the breeze.
